data.title: Great Hotel in Miami!
data.text: Had a business meeting in Miami and stayed at the JW Marriott - from the start this was a great hotel.  Staff were friendly and professional - made sure to ask a number of times if there was anything else that I needed.  Bellman did a great job of explaining the room and the local area.  Beds were comfortable and rooms were large.  Great hotel for staying in the business district!

data.title: A great location
data.text:
We wanted a place for a reunion and this hotel proved to an absolutely great location. It was in central downtown but a great place to access all the city. It was easy to walk out and one block from the water. There were lots of restaurant and bars nearby.
The staff were first class and the bar and concierge staff were extremely helpful, professional and friendly.
It was a $25 cab ride from the airport and the same to South Beach. It was in easy reach of the Bayside Marina and Bars
All in all a great location that I wouldn't have considered in the past but will certainly do it now

data.title: A fabulous Hotel
data.text:
From the moment we left our car with the valet, the excellent service began.    Courteous and caring.   The front desk registration clerk was so accommodating and instantly offered an upgraded room.   He offered other amenities and was most kind.   Our corner room with a view was beautiful.
We had a minor issue and they responded in minutes.
So clean...just perfect.
We sing their praises and cannot wait to return.
Thank you for a lovely stay.

data.title: *Hotel is not a 4 1/2 star hotel its not even close*
data.text: The rooms do not smell fresh and the carpets are dirty throughout the hotel. The staff was not at all friendly. Our family had two rooms and paid the high price based on the  4 1/2 star rating. Very disappointed. I have been a Marriott rewards member  for over 15 years and this is by far the worst Marriott that I have ever stayed at.

owner_response.author: , Executive Assistant at JW Marriott Miami, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for providing us with your feedback. We have shared your comments with the appropriate departments to address the flaws in service. I invite you to contact me directly to further discuss your experience with us at the JW Marriott Miami.

Best Regards, 

Jacquelyn Salazar
Executive Assistant
(305) 329-3502
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great and attentive
data.text: Valet service was excellent. Front desk was attentive, elevators were fast, and the room was clean and modern. However, They are undergoing construction right now, sleeping in will be difficult . Will stay again .

data.title: Top notch property
data.text: Large rooms, excellent service, perfect location.  What more could you ask?  We would stay here again.  Especially appreciated the executive lounge, open for breakfast, snacks, and dessert.  Well serviced.  Front desk was helpful.  Thank you, Marriott!

data.title: Everything perfect except for one annoying detail
data.text: The hotel, room, service, food and upkeep was as perfect as can be.  There is one annoying fact about the hotel as well as some others that is silly and always causes guests problems.  The elevators.  There is enough of them, they were clean, and they were quick.   Too quick in fact.  The elevators at this hotel require your room key to be inserted before the floor buttons are activated.  I was on the 16th floor but many guests on the lower floors had problems.  As soon as you enter the elevator teh door shuts and you have less than a few seconds to insert your card and select the floor. Now how many times does ittake for teh card to be read...not alqways the first time.  On three occasions someone missed their floor.

data.title: Best Hotel!
data.text: I had reserve a hotel from a website but when I got there, it was all full. They sent me to JW Marriott Miami. So far, it is my favorite hotel. The rooms are beautiful and so are the room. You will fall in love with this hotel.

data.title: Brickell Ave Area Miami
data.text: We had occasion to stay at this hotel due to some business that required we go to Miami and since it's quite a drive, we decided to stay at this hotel.  It was very convenient, it was within walking distance of where I had my meeting.  In fact, the walking in that area is terrific, wide sidewalks enough that my Mom could use her electric scooter.  There is a lot of work going on in that area, but that seems to be Miami generally.  If you go one way out of the hotel you are right there at the water and another way you can walk to shops, meetings, etc. ( It is a very business oriented area, lots of highrise business buildings).  We were told about Mary Brickell Village and probably that should have another review because we hated it.  The stores were not clean and it was difficult to find anything.  But, generally the area around there is quite nice.  They have a nice pool and hot tub, nice gym area with free flavored water, towels, etc.  All in all, it was very comfortable.  Keep in mind, however that they are doing some major renovation work and it can be a bit noisy at times, although really it didn't bother us at all.

data.title: Needs to be updated, badly
data.text:
Come here periodically with my husband for quick getaways. The long and short of it is although a great location which is easily accessible for what Miami has to offer and great staff, this hotel is dated and desperately needs updates. Most of the guest rooms have a terrible musty, almost moldy smell to them. Upon arrival we were placed on concierge level for our Marriott status but entered into a room that immediately knocked us out with the musty smell that was unbearable. We asked to change rooms and were placed 1 story down to a room with a balcony and a slightly more tolerable odor. Any type of odor of any kind is unacceptable unless of course it is pleasant and on purpose. We stayed here a couple months ago and noticed the same thing so I would be hard pressed to believe that this issue is just in the rooms we were placed in. Decor and color scheme is dark and outdated; time to change the yellow walls. Bathrooms are somewhat updated with mirrors that have tvs in them which I believe to be a terrible use of monies as the need for more practical, hygienic and aesthetic updates is obvious. 

I am typically a very positive person and love to give good ratings but it's really hard to give the hotel even the 3 stars. Friendly faces at check in, valet and concierge services are always nice, but at the end of day a comfortable, clean, safe welcoming hotel room to come back to at the end of the day is what matters most. Truly I had a headache from the smell in our rooms each time I entered them which is unacceptable; I'm of good health and am not particularly sensitive to odors in general so this has to tell you something. 

For future visits, we will take our business elsewhere, unless Marriott decides to renovate and improve the quality of their rooms here. We are loyol Marriott customers and know there are other properties in Miami but would even consider other brands if need be. Disappointed.

owner_response.author: johnzuniga, Front Office Manager at JW Marriott Miami, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear "Dratti",

First and most important, allow me the opportunity to apologize for your recent experience. We are taking measures to ensure your experience is not gone unheard. I have communicated your review the appropriate areas in an effort to address the flaws you mentioned.

Thank you for also expressing your kind impression on our staff and service. Should your travels bring you back to our area please feel free to contact me directly so I can personally provide you with a flawless experience.

Best regards,
John Zuniga
Front Office Manager
(305)329-3500
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very comfy and quiet
data.text:
On various ocasions I stood at this Hotel.
At every momento they made me feel at home, the romos are very cosy and quiet, the restaurant service very good and the locaiton itselve is perfect for you if you dont need to go to Miami Beach daily (the way up there is a Little long).
Only counterside is the Price, I wouldnt stay if I hat to pay it out of my pocket.

data.title: Very helpful staff
data.text: JW Marriott Miami have very helpful staff.  Cruzsoledad Flor went above and beyond! Their meeting staff were also very on-the-spot, very competently helping to resolve an audio problem right away.  The location is great - right in the heart of Brickell.

data.title: Nice hotel for business not vacation
data.text:
We stayed here for a night before a cruise.
I would not recommend this hotel for a start of vacation.
Nice place but quite a boring area. Few restaurants but expensive, and not much to see or do.
Great place if you're on a business trip though.

data.title: Holidays , just fun sun and great night time
data.text: The Hotel is great , the night life is fantastic , restaurants, the view the food is best to be expected . The  personnel are phenomenal.  The location is great. We use the gym as well as is real modern .

data.title: Great service but a little bit old
data.text:
I like the big room and bathroom but the Hotel in general is kinda old. The Restaurant staff was very kind and almost everybody in the Hotel speaks Spanish.
Nice outdoor pool... but nothing special...

data.title: Good location but average quality
data.text:
I had stayed 2 years ago in the JW Marriot Marquis in Miami and was a bit dissappointed with the facilities of JW Marriot on Brickell Av..

Swimming pool is deserted, the bar is not operated, works where going on (with some noise early morning) of which we were not informed when making the booking.  When calling for anything like room service, house keeping, you had to very patient and phone min. 3 times.  Even when complaining about missing soap / shampoo we had to wait 30 mins before we finally could take a shower.  Lack of proper management.

owner_response.author: , Front Office Manager at JW Marriott Miami, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear "CaptainMorgan68",

Please contact me directly as I would like the opportunity to formally apologize and open communication should you like to share further details.

Best regards,
John Zuniga
Front Office Manager
JW Marriott Miami
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hotel and location
data.text: Great hotel and location. The staff was super attentive and facilities are top notch.The gym is really nice and has a lot of extras (fresh water with cucumber, fresh fruit, etc). The concierge lounge is also really well stocked and staff was super friendly.

data.title: A solid 4.9 out of 5
data.text:
Stayed for 2 nights.

LIKES:
Friendly, professional staff at front desk
Express elevators are relatively quick
Clean, well-lit property
Large room and bathroom
Quiet
Comfortable bed
A/C kept room comfortable despite 90 degree weather outside
Computer desk and chair

DISLIKES:
Just a few tiny details keep this from being a perfect 5:
Pad of paper at computer desk had a single sheet left
In-room espresso, coffee, tea maker had plenty of tea, espresso and decaf, but NO coffee
Glass top at computer workstation incapacitated the mouse (I had to use hotel amenities binder)
Bathroom lighting was barely adequate for shaving

None of these minor issues would prevent me from returning, but it explains my 4.9 rating.

OTHER COMMENTS:
The lobby is beyond austere and not where you would want to spend much time. A single couch in an otherwise huge room. Food in the bar was surprisingly good. I ate just before closing; one employee seemed annoyed that my flight was late. The other was happy and chatty. Food in the breakfast / lunch dining area was good, although the waitress could take lessons from the desk staff for customer service. Forget about getting a cell phone to work anywhere in the building if you have Verizon. The entire area is one huge dead zone.

SUMMARY:
Despite a few minor annoyances (perhaps the cell service is bigger than annoying), I would still stay here again.

data.title: Notes from a big guy
data.text: Upon arrival, the main valet entrance is very nice, clean, and the valet were extremely helpful and personable. Check in was very quick and the girl checking me in was very kind and courteous. I had a corner king which was very spacious. It had views of the city that were nice too. The room was clean, the bed was softly firm and the linens were very nice and comfortable. The bathroom was very spacious but the toilet was pretty tight because I am a big guy and need more room so I took off some points for that. The TV was fuzzy but watchable. They had a very nice breakfast buffet and the room service was quick and on time. They add 20% gratuity to the bill which i hate. The area is located in a great area downtown.

data.title: Business Friendly
data.text:
Stayed here for a business trip to Miami. The hotel is very business friendly. There are several convenient restaurants, coffee shops, and meeting locations within the hotel. Check-in/check-out process was seamless and quick. The rooms are very large, clean, and well equipped - including a TV in the bathroom mirror. 

I would recommend this hotel for business travel if you were visiting the area. I would not stay here for personal travel (especially with a family) to the Miami area – there is too much of a corporate feel.

owner_response.author: , Front Office Manager at JW Marriott Miami, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear "TheTravelObsession",

Thank you for sharing your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. I will definitely share your review with the pertaining areas and I am glad we were able to provide you with quick and seamless service. 

Please feel free to contact me regarding this or any future stay while in the Miami area but most importantly, thank you for choosing our hotel as your home away from home.

Best regards,
John Zuniga
Front Office Manager
JW Marriott Miami
owner_response.title: Owner Response
